column4: I'm new to Ubuntu, I've just installed 8.10 on my desktop but I can't connect to a wireless network since I can't for the life of me find the option to do so. Right clicking on the Network Manager in the top taskbar gives me the option to edit connections which I have done, but there's no option to actually connect to the network.
The help file tells me to go to System -> Administration -> Network
But that option does not exist in the Administration menu
It should be.
Have you looked at our wifi page  or our supported hardware page
No eta on when they will be finished
okay thanks.
they are seldom down this long,
it's no problem. I just need to get some drivers for my wireless adapter, which I thought would work but the version I have actually requires ndiswrapper and some 64-bit drivers :/
What make model of wireless card
I have a Netgear WG311 v3
Let me see if I have any notes
thanks.
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Device/Netgear_WG311_v3
let me see if I can get em
It would be great if you could, although I don't mind waiting.
Please let me know if it does or does not work for you
wget ftp://downloads.netgear.com/files/wg311v3_1_0.zip
http://www.linuxquestions.org/questions/linux-wireless-networking-41/success-netgear-wg311v3-400257/

Those are the same drivers that are in the guide that I'm following. However, the guide states that those drivers don't work on the amd64 platform (which is what I'm on), and in which case, I should instead use the 3rd party drivers which it links to the forums. I'll wait for the forums to come back up instead.
I tried
yeah, much appreciated!!
